sentences.english: Elephants walk on tiptoe, they can walk in the mud easily.
sentences.chinese: 他們躡足而行，可以在泥淖中自如行走。

sentences.english: The children have dirtied up their clothes in that mud.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在泥淖裏把衣服弄得髒透了。

sentences.english: The United States is bogged down with debt and deficits, and is in desperate need of a growth strategy.
sentences.chinese: 美國陷在債務和赤字的泥淖，急需一個增長策略。

sentences.english: You crossed the little stream over a rickety bridge of bamboo and mud.
sentences.chinese: 你跨過一座搖搖欲墜的竹橋和泥淖渡過那條小溪。

definition: to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
lit. sea of bitterness/abyss of worldly suffering (Buddhist term)/depths of misery
to fall into/to dip below a certain level
to have difficulty walking (idiom)/to walk with difficulty
